bioghist.p: C. Dudley Brown A.I.D. is an interior designer and design consultant. His clients and projects have included The Cosmos Club, the Australian ambassador's residence, Glenview Mansion in Rockville, Capitol Hill Presbyterian Church, Kent Valentine House in Richmond, Virginia, and a number of Chevy Chase residences. In the 1960s, he was retained as a decorator and design consultant to the Cochran Chair Co. He was awarded the 2006 Mayor's Award for Excellence in Historic Preservation, served as the first president of the Washington Chapter of the Victorian Society in America and remains an active member of the board of the Society.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the alphabetical reference files of C. Dudley Brown. The files include newspaper and magazine clippings, product catalogs, and brochures. The bulk of the materials date from the 1950s and early 1960s, with a few items dating back to the mid-1930s. Topics covered by the files include antiques, clocks, display, early American furniture, modern furnishings, hardware, windows, and remodeling. Sources of articles include American Home, House Beautiful, New York Times Magazine, Better Homes and Gardens, and House and Garden. There is some material related to Brown's work for the Cochran Chair Co. including product catalogs, price lists, and a company history. The collection also includes lecture notes, papers, drawings, and reference material from courses taken by C. Dudley Brown on design, display, and professional practice, 1951-1952.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
